#summary Getting the Maestro source code.

== Maestro repository ==

The latest code is available from a [http://subversion.tigris.org/ Subversion (SVN)] repository which is hosted on this server. If you just want to see the source, you can [http://code.google.com/p/maestro/source/browse/ browse] through the code. Refer to the Google Code page for [http://code.google.com/p/maestro/source/checkout checking out the source] for further details.

== Dependencies ==

Maestro is built on top of several other Python libraries, some of which have dependencies of their own. The current set of required packages is as follows:

 * [http://www.python.org/ Python] 2.3 or newer
 * [http://www.trolltech.com/products/qt/downloads Qt 4.2.1]
 * [http://www.riverbankcomputing.co.uk/sip/download.php SIP 4.5]
 * [http://www.riverbankcomputing.co.uk/pyqt/download.php PyQt 4.1]
 * [http://twistedmatrix.com/trac/ Twisted] 2.4
 * [http://www.python.org/pyvault/SRPMS/repodata/repoview/python-crypto-0-2.0.1-2.html python-crypto] 2.0.1 ([http://www.voidspace.org.uk/python/modules.shtml#pycrypto Windows installers])
 * [http://pyopenssl.sourceforge.net/ pyOpenSSL] 0.6 ([http://twisted.sourceforge.net/contrib/pyOpenSSL-0.6.win32-py2.3.exe Windows installer for Python 2.3], [http://webcleaner.sourceforge.net/pyOpenSSL-0.6.win32-py2.4.exe Windows installer for Python 2.4], [http://webcleaner.sourceforge.net/pyOpenSSL-0.6.win32-py2.5.exe Windows installer for Python 2.5])
 * [http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=78018 pywin32] (Windows only)
 * [http://www.pangalactic.org/PyPAM/ PyPAM] (or python-pam) 0.4.2 (non-Windows platforms only)
   * Try searching for [http://www.google.com/search?hl=en&lr=&q=python-pam&btnG=Search python-pam] to find a pre-packaged version or use the attached source.
 * [http://effbot.org/zone/element-index.htm ElementTree 1.2.6-20050316]
